attributes.action:
Stop the development of the Sea Wall,
Protect the amenities and the businesses.
attributes.additional_details: The local council Fylde Borough are not listening even the local MP Mark Menzies has written to FBC and the EA to have proper consultation
attributes.background: The council have started  to propose a sea wall protection scheme that does not take into consideration the local amenities nor the disruption to the local businesses. We need a full scale public debat5e on the issue.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about local infrastructure improvements, including sea defences, are a matter for individual local authorities, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.

You could raise this issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them: https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors

You can also contact your local council directly. Find out how to contact your council here: https://new.fylde.gov.uk/contact-us/
